<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> May/June 2022 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 285, 450]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 808, 467]]<|/det|> Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|> Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|> Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|> Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 798, 544]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 892, 575]]<|/det|> You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 320, 590]]<|/det|> You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 590, 578, 606]]<|/det|> You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 220, 650]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 384, 666]]<|/det|> The total mark for this paper is 40. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 730, 682]]<|/det|> The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[712, 712, 907, 841]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 868, 611, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 739, 89]]<|/det|>
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 94, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 685, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the motion of a spring system.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 628, 151]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with two springs connected by string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 165, 544, 183]]<|/det|>
● Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 203, 814, 870]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 881, 534, 898]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 173, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
The lower mass is \(m\). Arrange **all** of the slotted masses so that \(m\) is \(250\mathrm{g}\) and the remaining slotted masses are in the upper string loop.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 175, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 119, 621, 136]]<|/det|>
Pull the **lower** mass down through a short distance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 151, 175, 166]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 149, 561, 166]]<|/det|>
Release the mass. The system will oscillate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 181, 175, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 180, 697, 198]]<|/det|>
Determine the period \(T\) of the oscillations of the **upper** mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 336, 920, 352]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ............................................................ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 365, 148, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 365, 910, 384]]<|/det|>
Transfer some of the slotted masses from the lower string loop to the upper string loop.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 397, 175, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 397, 495, 415]]<|/det|>
Record the value of the upper mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[467, 444, 917, 461]]<|/det|>
<form>upper mass = ..........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 475, 175, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 475, 384, 492]]<|/det|>
Record the value of \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 505, 917, 522]]<|/det|>
<form>m = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 175, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 536, 697, 554]]<|/det|>
Determine the period \(T\) of the oscillations of the **upper** mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 705, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 720, 920, 739]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 890, 89]]<|/det|>
Change \(m\) by moving slotted masses between the two string loops and then determine \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(m\) and \(T\). You may include your results from **(a)** and **(b)**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 148, 698, 166]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\sqrt{T}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 535, 144, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 535, 175, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 535, 667, 554]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\sqrt{T}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(m\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 567, 180, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 567, 457, 585]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 598, 180, 616]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 598, 608, 616]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 814, 917, 832]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 845, 917, 863]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ..........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 861, 920, 880]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 739, 91]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 97, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 688, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium of a metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a metre rule and a tube.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 144, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 165, 183, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 165, 920, 199]]<|/det|>
· The distance between the centre of the hole in the metre rule and the \(50\mathrm{cm}\) mark on the metre rule is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[170, 212, 814, 316]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 333, 534, 351]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 364, 562, 382]]<|/det|>
Determine \(L\). Give your value in metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 395, 920, 413]]<|/det|>
<form>L = ............................................................ m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 443, 220, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 443, 700, 460]]<|/det|>
The outer diameter of the tube is \(d\), as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 472, 784, 574]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 603, 534, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 634, 643, 651]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(d\). Give your value in metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 664, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
<form>d = ............................................................ m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 680, 920, 698]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 695, 181, 714]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 695, 643, 714]]<|/det|>
Calculate the cross-sectional area \(A\) of the tube where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 720, 536, 749]]<|/det|>
\[A = \frac{\pi d^2}{4}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 834, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
<form>A = .................................................... m² [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 180, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 72, 210, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 583, 89]]<|/det|>
Add sand to the tube as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[363, 100, 640, 400]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 415, 534, 434]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Fig. 2.3](Fig. 2.3)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 447, 218, 465]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 447, 520, 465]]<|/det|>
The height of sand in the tube is \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 477, 794, 496]]<|/det|>
Adjust the amount of sand in the tube until \(x\) is approximately \(12 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 509, 220, 527]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 509, 641, 527]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(x\). Give your value in metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 540, 920, 558]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ....................................................... m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 571, 220, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 571, 562, 590]]<|/det|>
Push the stopper securely into the tube.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 215, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.4. Place the beaker containing water inside the tray.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 114, 875, 448]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 459, 591, 477]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 490, 215, 507]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 489, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
Using the hook, suspend the tube from the string loop and place the tube in the water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 537, 215, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 536, 920, 570]]<|/det|>
The distance between the bottom of the tube and the surface of the water in the beaker is \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 583, 920, 616]]<|/det|>
Adjust the apparatus so that the rule is balanced on the rod of the clamp, the rule is parallel to the bench and the value of \(h\) is approximately \(5 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 631, 213, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 630, 818, 648]]<|/det|>
The distance between the rod of the clamp and the hole in the rule is \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 660, 702, 677]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(h\) and \(y\). Give your values in metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 752, 920, 770]]<|/det|>
<form>h = ....................................................... m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 784, 920, 802]]<|/det|>
<form>y = ....................................................... m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 800, 920, 817]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 630, 91]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that the relationship between \(y\), \(x\) and C is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 98, 549, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{y} = kx + C\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 339, 152]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 507, 183]]<|/det|>
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 336, 918, 355]]<|/det|>
<form>first value of \(k =\) ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 368, 918, 387]]<|/det|>
<form>second value of \(k =\) ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 751, 433]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 445, 828, 465]]<|/det|>
